decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Shuko to mill the entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. It includes protection and card selection spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Force of Will, along with disruption tools like Daze and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also utilizes cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Meticulous Archive for additional value and utilizes lands like Cavern of Souls and Tundra for mana fixing.

The main concept of this Legacy Doomsday combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday and use it to set up a winning scenario with Thassa's Oracle. The deck contains a mix of mana acceleration, card draw, disruption, and protection spells to efficiently execute the combo. Cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Lion's Eye Diamond help generate mana quickly, while Daze, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will help protect the combo. Spoils of the Vault can be used to find specific cards needed for the combo setup, making it a key component of the strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through aggressive creature plays while also disrupting their game plan with proactive disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment and the ability to outpace the opponent. Additionally, the deck features a mix of removal options and disruptive creatures to control the board and maintain an advantage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while also providing access to key cards like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and counterspells. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's progress while generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. By efficiently removing threats and countering key spells, the deck can stabilize the board and take over the game with powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Flame of Anor. The mana base is designed to support the deck's triple-color requirements while also providing access to powerful utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers. The deck aims to close out the game quickly by reducing the opponent's resources and overwhelming them with powerful threats. The use of ramp cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive plays and the ability to drop high-impact cards like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator ahead of schedule.

The key concept of this Aggro Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly ramping into powerful dragons and artifacts with cards like Chrome Mox, City of Traitors, and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with cards like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury, while also having access to removal and disruption spells like Sundering Eruption and Soul-Guide Lantern to control the board and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures and disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells. It also utilizes removal spells to control the board and ensure its creatures can get through to deal damage. The deck's strategy is to apply early pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot, using its aggressive creatures to close out the game efficiently. Additionally, it includes some graveyard hate in the form of Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt any opposing strategies that rely on the graveyard.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Grindstone and Painter's Servant combo to mill opponents' library. The deck includes various artifacts and creatures that support this combo, as well as cards like Force of Will for protection. The deck also includes card draw options like Thoughtcast and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to maintain consistency. Additionally, the deck features control elements such as Sink into Stupor and Metallic Rebuke to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, this deck aims to execute its combo efficiently while controlling the game state.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide, Lotus Petal, and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void is also used to disrupt the opponent's spells, while Wasteland helps to control their mana base. The deck aims to apply early pressure and overwhelm the opponent with efficient and high-impact creatures, utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to generate even more advantage.

The deck focuses on using cards like Entomb and Reanimate to quickly put powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, allowing for explosive early-game plays. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt opponent's strategies while protecting its own combo pieces with cards like Force of Will. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty while also maintaining card advantage and selection through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently execute a game-winning combo by casting a series of spells that allow the player to put their entire deck into their graveyard. Thassa's Oracle is then used to win the game on the spot by having no cards left in their library. Cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, Simian Spirit Guide, and Chrome Mox are used to generate mana quickly, while cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy help to mill the deck. Pact of Negation is used to protect the combo from disruption.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while generating value from the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam and Grist, the Hunger Tide. It utilizes a combination of hand disruption, creature removal, and land destruction to control the game state. The Urza's Saga land helps to find key artifacts like Mox Diamond and Pithing Needle, while Orcish Bowmasters and Malevolent Rumble provide additional removal options. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by utilizing graveyard recursion and resource denial strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, while utilizing powerful combo pieces such as Planar Nexus, Kozilek's Command, and Eldrazi Confluence. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, while also generating card advantage with Ponder and Stock Up. Karn, the Great Creator serves as a versatile utility card, and Thundertrap Trainer provides additional creature removal. The deck also includes powerful win conditions such as The One Ring and Batterskull for late-game dominance.

This Legacy Death & Taxes deck focuses on utilizing Aether Vial and various creatures to disrupt opponents while applying pressure to win quickly. The deck includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and disruption with Thoughtseize. It also incorporates powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition to handle threats efficiently. By using powerful creatures and disruption spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a board presence and quickly closing out the game. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds an additional dimension to the deck's strategy.

This Legacy combo deck utilizes Mystic Forge and various artifact mana accelerants to quickly assemble a powerful board state. By combining cards like Grim Monolith, Manifold Key, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, the deck aims to generate infinite mana, cast spells from the top of the library with Mystic Forge, and ultimately win the game with either a massive storm count or by creating a lethal board presence. The inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Pithing Needle provide additional utility and disruption against the opponent's game plan.

This Legacy deck focuses on quickly and aggressively casting a large number of spells to win the game in one explosive turn. By utilizing a combination of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and rituals, along with cards like Simian Spirit Guide, the player aims to quickly assemble their combo pieces - Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer - to mill their entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo.
